revised_title: Characterizing Particle Trajectories in Classical Lennard-Jones Liquids
tldr: The authors analyze the trajectories of particles in a classical Lennard-Jones liquid using molecular dynamics simulations. They examine the characteristics of the single particle motion, such as the intervals between velocity vector changes and the amplitude of quasi-oscillations. The study provides insights into the nature of the liquid state and may contribute to the development of realistic physical models.
